subject: Re: [junit] Use Cases for JUnit Rules
msgSnippet: I agree, Rules are great. +1 for highlighting them (and the possible use-cases) in JUnit docs. Dawid
messageBody:
I agree, Rules are great. +1 for highlighting them (and the possible
use-cases) in JUnit docs.

Dawid

On Mon, Aug 16, 2010 at 7:25 AM, Kent Beck <kentb@...> wrote:
> Jens,
>
> Thank you for sharing your experiences. Rules have been the best surprise in years. People are using them in totally unexpected ways.
>
> Kent
>
> On Aug 15, 2010, at 9:57 PM, jens_schauder wrote:
>
>> I have used JUnits @Rule a couple of times now in real projects and I think it really rocks. But few seem to know about this feature and even less seem to understand its use cases. In order to help with this I bloged about the Use Cases of JUnit Rules.
>>
>> http://blog.schauderhaft.de/2010/08/15/use-cases-for-junit-rules/
>>
>> Jens Schauder
>>
>>
>
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
